STANDARD MARRIAGE CEREMONY

Will you all please stand for the bride’s entrance.

You may all be seated.

Prynhawn / Bora da, ar ran _______________________ a minnau _______________________, ga i eich croesawu’n gynnes iawn i _______________________ i ddathlu priodas _______________________ â _______________________.

Good afternoon / morning, on behalf of _______________________ and myself _______________________, I would like to extend a warm welcome you all here to _______________________ to celebrate the marriage of _______________________ and _______________________.

The place in which you have now met has been duly sanctioned according to the law for the celebration of marriages. You are here to witness the joining in matrimony of _______________________ and _______________________.

If any person present knows of any lawful impediment to this marriage, then he or she should declare it now.

Before you are joined in matrimony, I have to remind you of the solemn and binding character of the ceremony of marriage.

Marriage, according to the law of this country is the union of one man with one woman, voluntarily entered into for life to the exclusion of all others.

The purpose of marriage is that you will always love, care for, and support each other through all the joys and sorrows of life, and that love may be fulfilled in a relationship of permanent and loving commitment.

Can I please ask _______________________ to come forward with a reading.

*************

Now I am going to ask each of you in turn to declare that you know of no lawful reason why you may not be joined in matrimony to each other.

Groom to Bride

_______________________ please repeat after me:

Option 1

I do solemnly declare // that I know of no legal reason // why I, _______________________, // may not be joined in matrimony to _______________________.

Option 2

I declare that // I know of no legal reason // why I _______________________ // may not be joined in matrimony to _______________________.

Option 3

By replying ‘I am’ to the question “Are you _______________________ free lawfully to marry _______________________?”

Bride to Groom

_______________________ please repeat after me:

Option 1

Option 2

I declare that // I know of no legal reason // why I _______________________ // may not be joined in matrimony to _______________________.

Option 3

By replying ‘I am’ to the question “Are you _______________________ free lawfully to marry _______________________?”

*************

Now the moment has come for _______________________and _______________________to contract their marriage before you their witnesses. Will you all please stand.

Groom to Bride

_______________________ please repeat after me:

Option 1

I call upon these persons here present // to witness that I _______________________ // do take thee _______________________ // to be my lawful wedded wife.

Option 2

I _______________________ // take thee _______________________ // to be my wedded wife.

Bride to Groom

_______________________ please repeat after me:

Option 1

I call upon these persons here present // to witness that I _______________________ // do take thee _______________________ // to be my lawful wedded husband.

Option 2

I _______________________ // take _______________________ // to be my wedded husband.

*************

We now come to the giving of the wedding ring/s which is the outward sign of the traditional way of sealing the bond which you have made with one another.

Can I please ask _______________________ to come forward with the wedding rings.

Groom to Bride

_______________________ please take _______________________’s ring and place it on her third finger on the left hand and repeat after me :

Option 1

I give you this ring as a symbol of my love.

Option 2

I give you this ring // as a symbol // of my enduring love and affection. // I promise // to share my life fully with you, // to cherish and tenderly care for you, // to honour and encourage you, // to respect you as an individual // and to be true to you // through good times and bad.

Option 3

I give you this ring // as a token of our marriage // and as a symbol of my love // and all that we share. // Please wear it // with a feeling of love and pride // now and always.

Option 4

I give you this ring // as a sign of our marriage // and as a lasting reminder // of the vows made between us today. // It is a pledge // that I will honour you // and share with you // all that I possess // and that we will be together // from today onwards // through all the changing scenes of life // be they good or ill // and I will love and care for you // until Life’s end.

You may all be seated.

*************

Can I please ask _______________________ to come forward with a reading.

_______________________ and _______________________ you have both made the declarations prescribed by law, and have made a solemn and binding contract with each other, in the presence of your witnesses, family and friends.

May this day form a milestone in your lives to look back upon with much love and happiness. May the feelings of love that you have for each other deepen and grow even stronger throughout the years to come.

It therefore, gives me great pleasure to announce that you are now husband and wife together.
